text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Transport of 

Dangerous Goods by Rail) (Amendment) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 30 June 2021.

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Transport of
heading: 3. Regulation 2(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
3. Regulation 2(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) by the substitution of the following definition for the definition 
of “Directive” (inserted by Regulation 2(a) of the European 
Union (Transport of Dangerous Goods by Rail) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 247 of 2019)): 

“ ‘Directive’ means Directive 2008/68/EC of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 24 September 20081, as 
amended by - 

(a) Commission Directive 2010/61/EU of 2 September 

20102,

2 OJ No. L260, 30.09.2008, p.13 
1 OJ No. L260, 30.09.2008, p.13

7 OJ No. L408, 04.12.2020, p.1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th April, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [177] 3 

(b) Commission Directive 2012/45/EU of 3 December 

20123, 

(c) Commission Directive 
November 20144, 

2014/103/EU 

of 

21 

(d) Commission Directive (EU) 2016/2309 of 16 

December 20165, 

(e) Commission Directive (EU) 2018/1846 of 23 

November 20186, and 

(f) Commission Delegated Directive (EU) 2020/1833 of 

2 October 20207;”, and 

(b) by the substitution of the following definition for the definition 
of “RID” (inserted by Regulation 2(b) of the European Union 
(Transport of Dangerous Goods by Rail) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2019) (S.I. No. 247 of 2019)): 

“ ‘RID’ means the ‘Regulations concerning the International 
Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Rail (RID)’, appearing as 
Appendix C to the ‘Convention concerning International 
Carriage by Rail (COTIF)’ concluded at Vilnius on 3 June 1999, 
as applicable with effect from 1 January 2009 and as referred to 
in section II.1 in Annex II to the Directive, as applicable with 
effect from 1 January 2021;”.

heading: 4. Regulation 31(2)(a) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the
text_raw:
4. Regulation 31(2)(a) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the 
substitution of 
 “European Union (Railway Safety) (Reporting and 
Investigation of Serious Accidents, Accidents and Incidents) Regulations 2020 
(S.I. No. 430 of 2020)” for “European Union (Railway Safety) (Reporting and 
Investigation of Serious Accidents, Accidents and Incidents) Regulations 2014 
(S.I. No. 258 of 2014)”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 April, 2021. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport.

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Transport of
heading: (This is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to amend the European Communities 
(Transport of Dangerous Goods by Rail) Regulations 2010 (S.I. No. 651 of 
2010) in line with the technical amendment made by Commission Delegated 
Directive (EU) 2020/1833 of 2 October 2020 in regard to inland transport of 
dangerous goods by rail (RID). The amendment provides that the reference to 
“RID Contracting State” in Annex II, as applicable from 1 January 2021, is 
replaced by “Member State”.
